results.title: Results
results.description: List of results for each ingested memory item.

is_valid.description: Whether the API key is valid

content_url.description: Direct URL for content retrieval when different from the reference URL.

misc.description: Additional attachment attributes defined by the tenant (free-form).

memories.title: Memories
memories.description: List of memory items to ingest

sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

upsert.title: Upsert
upsert.description: If true, update existing sources with the same source_id.

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: Optional source ID to filter by (mutually exclusive with chunk_ids)

chunk_ids.title: Chunk Ids
chunk_ids.description: Optional list of chunk IDs to filter by (mutually exclusive with source_id)

output_fields.title: Output Fields
output_fields.description: Optional list of fields to return in results (default: chunk_id, source_id, metadata)

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

embeddings.description: List of raw embedding documents to insert

upsert.title: Upsert
upsert.description: If True, update existing embeddings; if False, insert only

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

query_embedding.title: Query Embedding
query_embedding.description: Query embedding vector to search for

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

filter_expr.title: Filter Expr
filter_expr.description: Optional Milvus filter expression for additional filtering

output_fields.title: Output Fields
output_fields.description: Optional list of fields to return in results (default: chunk_id, source_id, metadata)

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

upsert.title: Upsert
upsert.description: If true, update existing sources with the same id.

files.title: Files
files.description: Files to upload (documents). Omit or leave empty when only sending app_sources.

file_metadata.title: File Metadata
file_metadata.description: JSON array of file metadata objects; length must match files when provided.

app_sources.title: App Sources
app_sources.description: JSON: single source object or array of app-generated sources to index. Omit when only uploading files.

row_count.title: Row Count
row_count.description: Number of rows in the collection

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Number of dimensions in the collection

text.title: Text
text.description: Plain text content extracted or provided for indexing.

html_base64.title: Html Base64
html_base64.description: Base64-encoded HTML content preserving structure and formatting.

csv_base64.title: Csv Base64
csv_base64.description: Base64-encoded CSV data for tabular content ingestion.

markdown.title: Markdown
markdown.description: Raw Markdown content to be indexed as rich text.

files.title: Files
files.description: List of file descriptors associated with the source (e.g., filenames, sizes).

layout.title: Layout
layout.description: Optional layout metadata such as sections or blocks to guide chunking.

name.title: Name
name.description: Property name (used as field name in Milvus)

data_type.description: Milvus data type. Use VARCHAR for text fields that need embeddings.

max_length.title: Max Length
max_length.description: Max length for VARCHAR fields. Increase for longer text content.

enable_analyzer.title: Enable Analyzer
enable_analyzer.description: Enable text analyzer for full-text search capabilities

enable_match.title: Enable Match
enable_match.description: Enable TEXT_MATCH filtering on this field

enable_dense_embedding.title: Enable Dense Embedding
enable_dense_embedding.description: Create a dense embedding field (FLOAT_VECTOR) for semantic similarity search. Only applicable to VARCHAR fields. A corresponding '{name}_embedding' field will be created.

enable_sparse_embedding.title: Enable Sparse Embedding
enable_sparse_embedding.description: Create a sparse embedding field (BM25) for keyword search. Only applicable to VARCHAR fields. A corresponding '{name}_sparse' field and BM25 function will be created.

CustomPropertyDefinition.title: CustomPropertyDefinition
CustomPropertyDefinition.description:
Definition for custom/dynamic properties on a collection.

Use this to define tenant metadata fields that can enhance search capabilities:
- enable_dense_embedding: Creates a dense vector field for semantic similarity search
- enable_sparse_embedding: Creates a sparse vector field for BM25 keyword search

Example:
    CustomPropertyDefinition(
        name="product_description",
        data_type=MilvusDataType.VARCHAR,
        max_length=4096,
        enable_dense_embedding=True,  # Enables semantic search on this field
        enable_sparse_embedding=True,  # Enables keyword search on this field
    )

success.title: Success
success.description: Indicates whether the memory deletion operation was successful

user_memory_deleted.title: User Memory Deleted
user_memory_deleted.description: Confirms whether the specific memory was successfully deleted

DeleteUserMemoryResponse.title: DeleteUserMemoryResponse
DeleteUserMemoryResponse.description: Response model for deleting a user memory.

type.title: Type
type.description: PERSON, ORGANIZATION, PROJECT, PRODUCT, ERROR_CODE, etc.

entity_id.title: Entity Id
entity_id.description: Internal unique entity ID from graph database

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Unique ID like email, employee_id, URL

cortex_source_ids.title: Cortex Source Ids
cortex_source_ids.description: Cortex source IDs to forcefully relate to the uploaded source.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Optional properties to attach to the forceful relation.

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

query.title: Query
query.description: Search terms to find in your content

operator.description: How to combine search terms (OR or AND)

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

search_mode.description: What to search: 'sources' for documents or 'memories' for user memories

GraphContext.title: GraphContext
GraphContext.description: Graph context containing query-based paths and chunk-based relation paths.

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

query.title: Query
query.description: Search terms to find relevant content

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

recency_bias.title: Recency Bias
recency_bias.description: Preference for newer content (0.0 = no bias, 1.0 =             strong recency preference)

personalise_recall.title: Personalise Recall
personalise_recall.description: Enable personalized search results based on user preferences

graph_context.title: Graph Context
graph_context.description: Enable graph context for search results

additional_context.title: Additional Context
additional_context.description: Additional context provided by the user to guide retrieval

search_mode.description: What to search: 'sources' for documents or 'memories' for user memories

metadata_filters.title: Metadata Filters
metadata_filters.description: Optional key-value pairs to filter search results by tenant metadata fields. Keys must match fields defined in tenant_metadata_schema during tenant creation. Supports exact match filtering on indexed metadata fields. Example: {'category': 'engineering', 'priority': 'high'}

kind.description: Whether to list normal sources or user memories.

source_ids.title: Source Ids
source_ids.description: Optional list of IDs to fetch. If omitted, returns all.

ListContentRequest.title: ListContentRequest
ListContentRequest.description:
Unified request model for listing either sources or user memories.

If `source_ids` is provided and non-empty, only those IDs are returned.
Otherwise, all items for the tenant/sub-tenant scope are returned.

success.title: Success
success.description: Indicates whether the memory listing operation was successful

user_memories.title: User Memories
user_memories.description: Array of all user memories associated with your tenant

example.memory_content: I prefer detailed technical explanations and works in the Pacific timezone

ListUserMemoriesResponse.title: ListUserMemoriesResponse
ListUserMemoriesResponse.description: Response model for listing all user memories.

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: Optional unique identifier. Auto-generated if not provided.

title.title: Title
title.description: Display title for this memory item.

text.title: Text
text.description: Raw text or markdown content to be indexed.
examples:
# Introduction

This is the document content.

user_assistant_pairs.title: User Assistant Pairs
user_assistant_pairs.description: Array of user/assistant conversation pairs to store as memory.

is_markdown.title: Is Markdown
is_markdown.description: Whether the text is markdown formatted.

infer.title: Infer
infer.description: If true, process and extract additional insights/inferences from the contentbefore indexingUseful for extracting implicit information from conversations

custom_instructions.title: Custom Instructions
custom_instructions.description: Custom instructions to guide inference processing.

user_name.title: User Name
user_name.description: User's name for personalization in conversation pairs.

expiry_time.title: Expiry Time
expiry_time.description: Optional TTL in seconds for this memory.

tenant_metadata.title: Tenant Metadata
tenant_metadata.description:
JSON string containing tenant-level document metadata (e.g., department, compliance_tag)

Example: > "{"department":"Finance","compliance_tag":"GDPR"}"

document_metadata.title: Document Metadata
document_metadata.description:
JSON string containing document-specific metadata (e.g., title, author, file_id). If file_id is not provided, the system will generate an ID automatically.

Example: > "{"title":"Q1 Report.pdf","author":"Alice Smith","file_id":"custom_file_123"}"

relations.description: Forcefully connect 2 sources based on cortex source ids or common properties.

MemoryItem.title: MemoryItem
MemoryItem.description:
Represents a single memory item for ingestion.
Supports raw text, markdown, and user/assistant conversation pairs.

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: Unique identifier for the ingested source.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title of the memory if provided.

infer.title: Infer
infer.description: Whether inference was requested for this memory.

MemoryResultItem.title: MemoryResultItem
MemoryResultItem.description: Result for a single ingested memory item.

MilvusDataType.title: MilvusDataType
MilvusDataType.description: Milvus data types mapped from Weaviate schema.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: Identifier for the file whose status is being retrieved

indexing_status.title: Indexing Status
indexing_status.description: Current status of the file. Possible values are 'queued', 'processing', 'completed', 'errored', 'graph_creation', 'success'. 'graph_creation' indicates the file is indexed but the knowledge graph is still being created. 'success' is an alias for 'completed'.

error_code.title: Error Code
error_code.description: Error code for the file. You may share this code with us to help us diagnose and resolve the issue.

message.title: Message
message.description: Detailed status message about the processing operation

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

question.title: Question
question.description: The question to answer based on indexed sources

max_chunks.title: Max Chunks
max_chunks.description: Maximum number of context chunks to retrieve

mode.description: Retrieval mode: 'fast' for single query, 'accurate' for multi-query with reranking

search_mode.description: What to search: 'sources' for documents or 'memories' for user memories

include_graph_context.title: Include Graph Context
include_graph_context.description: Whether to include knowledge graph context for enhanced answers

extra_context.title: Extra Context
extra_context.description: Additional context to guide retrieval and answer generation

model.title: Model
model.description: Specific model to use (defaults to provider's default model)

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: LLM temperature for answer generation (lower = more focused)

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: Maximum tokens for the generated answer

QnASearchRequest.title: QnASearchRequest
QnASearchRequest.description: Request model for the QnA search API.

answer.title: Answer
answer.description: The AI-generated answer based on retrieved context

chunks.title: Chunks
chunks.description: Retrieved context chunks used to generate the answer

graph_context.description: Knowledge graph context (entity paths and chunk relations)

model_used.title: Model Used
model_used.description: The LLM model used for answer generation

QnASearchResponse.title: QnASearchResponse
QnASearchResponse.description: Response model for the QnA search API.

embeddings.title: Embeddings
embeddings.description: Embedding payloads containing ids and vectors

RawEmbeddingDocument.title: RawEmbeddingDocument
RawEmbeddingDocument.description: A raw embedding document for direct insert/upsert operations.

embedding.description: Embedding payload with chunk id and vector (if set)

RawEmbeddingSearchResult.title: RawEmbeddingSearchResult
RawEmbeddingSearchResult.description: Search result for raw embedding collections.

RawEmbeddingVector.title: RawEmbeddingVector
RawEmbeddingVector.description: Embedding payload containing the chunk identifier and vector.

context.title: Context
context.description: Rich contextual description of the relationship with surrounding information, details about how/why/when, and any relevant background. Should be comprehensive enough to understand the relationship without referring back to source.

temporal_details.title: Temporal Details
temporal_details.description: Temporal timing information extracted from text (e.g., 'last week', 'in 2023', 'yesterday')

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: Timestamp when this relation was introduced

relationship_id.title: Relationship Id
relationship_id.description: Unique ID for this relationship from graph database

chunk_id.title: Chunk Id
chunk_id.description: ID of the chunk this relation was extracted from

source_entity_id.title: Source Entity Id
source_entity_id.description: The entity ID of source node

target_entity_id.title: Target Entity Id
target_entity_id.description: The entity ID of target node

RelationEvidence.title: RelationEvidence
RelationEvidence.description: Single piece of evidence for a relationship between two entities

additional_context.title: Additional Context
additional_context.description: Map of chunk_uuid to VectorStoreChunk for extra context from forcefully related sources. Use chunk.extra_context_ids to look up chunks: extra_context[id] for id in chunk.extra_context_ids.

RetrievalResult.title: RetrievalResult
RetrievalResult.description: Result of a hybrid search retrieval operation.

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: Path group identifier (e.g., 'p_0') for chunk mapping

SearchMode.title: SearchMode
SearchMode.description: Search mode to specify what type of content to search.

source_ids.title: Source Ids
source_ids.description: List of source IDs to delete.

SourceDeleteRequest.title: SourceDeleteRequest
SourceDeleteRequest.description: Request to delete sources by their IDs.

SourceDeleteResultItem.title: SourceDeleteResultItem
SourceDeleteResultItem.description: Result for a single source deletion.

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: Source ID of the file to fetch

mode.description: Fetch mode: 'content' returns file content, 'url' returns presigned URL, 'both' returns both

expiry_seconds.title: Expiry Seconds
expiry_seconds.description: Expiry time in seconds for presigned URL (60-604800, default: 3600)

SourceFetchRequest.title: SourceFetchRequest
SourceFetchRequest.description: Request to fetch source file content.

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: Source ID of the fetched file

content.title: Content
content.description: File content as string (if mode includes 'content')

content_base64.title: Content Base64
content_base64.description: File content as base64 encoded string (for binary files, if mode includes 'content')

presigned_url.title: Presigned Url
presigned_url.description: Presigned URL to access the file (if mode includes 'url')

size_bytes.title: Size Bytes
size_bytes.description: Size of the file in bytes

success.title: Success
success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful

message.title: Message
message.description: Response message describing the operation result

total.title: Total
total.description: Total number of sources matching the query.

id.title: Id
id.description: Stable, unique identifier for the source. If omitted, one may be generated upstream.

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

title.title: Title
title.description: Short human-readable title for the source.

type.title: Type
type.description: High-level category of the source (e.g., document, email, ticket).

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional long-form description providing additional context.

note.title: Note
note.description: Free-form notes for internal use or ingestion hints.

url.title: Url
url.description: Canonical URL or reference link associated with the source.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: Creation or last-updated timestamp of the source in ISO-8601 format.

content.description: Primary content payload used for indexing and retrieval.

tenant_metadata.title: Tenant Metadata
tenant_metadata.description:
JSON string containing tenant-level document metadata (e.g., department, compliance_tag)

Example: > "{"department":"Finance","compliance_tag":"GDPR"}"

document_metadata.title: Document Metadata
document_metadata.description:
JSON string containing document-specific metadata (e.g., title, author, file_id). If file_id is not provided, the system will generate an ID automatically.

Example: > "{"title":"Q1 Report.pdf","author":"Alice Smith","file_id":"custom_file_123"}"

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: System-provided attributes (e.g., app_name, local file size) not intended for search filtering.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description: Attachments related to the source such as images, PDFs, or supplemental files.

results.title: Results
results.description: List of upload results for each source.

failed_count.title: Failed Count
failed_count.description: Number of sources that failed to upload.

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: Unique identifier for the uploaded source.

embeddings_dimension.title: Embeddings Dimension
embeddings_dimension.description: Embedding dimensions for embeddings tenant. Not required for non-embeddings (is_embeddings_tenant=False) tenants

tenant_metadata_schema.title: Tenant Metadata Schema
tenant_metadata_schema.description: Schema definition for tenant metadata fields. Each field can be configured for: filtering (enable_match), semantic search (enable_dense_embedding), and/or keyword search (enable_sparse_embedding). Fields with embeddings enabled must be VARCHAR type.

TenantCreateRequest.title: TenantCreateRequest

metadata_schema.description: Summary of configured tenant metadata schema (if provided)

message.title: Message
message.default: Tenant created and infra provisioning triggered

field_count.title: Field Count
field_count.description: Number of custom metadata fields configured

dense_embedding_fields.title: Dense Embedding Fields
dense_embedding_fields.description: Fields with dense embeddings enabled for semantic search

sparse_embedding_fields.title: Sparse Embedding Fields
sparse_embedding_fields.description: Fields with sparse embeddings enabled for keyword search

TenantMetadataSchemaInfo.title: TenantMetadataSchemaInfo
TenantMetadataSchemaInfo.description: Summary of configured tenant metadata schema fields.

chunk_id.title: Chunk Id
chunk_id.description: The chunk_id these relations are associated with

TripletWithEvidence.title: TripletWithEvidence
TripletWithEvidence.description: Triple with multiple evidence items from different chunks

assistant.title: Assistant
assistant.description: Assistant's response to the user message

memory_id.title: Memory Id
memory_id.description: Unique identifier for the user memory

memory_content.title: Memory Content
memory_content.description: The actual memory content text that was stored
examples: User prefers dark mode interface and uses keyboard shortcuts

UserMemory.title: UserMemory
UserMemory.description: Represents a user memory stored in the system.

chunk_uuid.title: Chunk Uuid
chunk_uuid.description: Unique identifier for this content chunk

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: Unique identifier for the source document

chunk_content.title: Chunk Content
chunk_content.description: The actual text content of this chunk
examples: This is a chunk of text from the source document.

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: Type of the source document (file, webpage, etc.)

source_upload_time.title: Source Upload Time
source_upload_time.description: When the source document was originally uploaded

source_title.title: Source Title
source_title.description: Title or name of the source document

source_last_updated_time.title: Source Last Updated Time
source_last_updated_time.description: When the source document was last modified

layout.title: Layout
layout.description: Layout of the chunk in original document. You will generally receive        a stringified dict with 2 keys, `offsets` and `page`(optional). Offsets will have        `document_level_start_index` and `page_level_start_index`(optional)

relevancy_score.title: Relevancy Score
relevancy_score.description: Score indicating how relevant this chunk is to your search query,         with higher values indicating better matches

document_metadata.title: Document Metadata
document_metadata.description: Metadata extracted from the source document

tenant_metadata.title: Tenant Metadata
tenant_metadata.description: Custom metadata associated with your tenant

extra_context_ids.title: Extra Context Ids
extra_context_ids.description: IDs of related chunks providing extra context (from forceful relations). Only present in accurate mode when sources have forceful relations.
